Detailed Description

Class that implements a user action.

This class represents an action that the user can perform in the interface via pressing a hot key or clicking on a menu/toolbar item.

All action items are added to a list of interface actions which the user can customize. The user can specify their own keyboard shortcut or 'Hot Key' for the action, and any action item can be moved into a custom toolbar, as well as appear in the DAZ Studio main menu.

To add a new action item to DAZ Studio, simply subclass DzAction and export the new class from a plug-in (see DzPlugin for more information). Then, reimplement the executeAction() function in your new class to perform the action. Below is an example that illustrates how to do this:

    // myaction.h - A plug-in header file:

    #include "dzaction.h"

    class MyAction : public DzAction {
        Q_OBJECT
    public:
        MyAction();
        virtual QKeySequence    getDefaultAccel() const;
    protected:
        virtual void executeAction();
    };

    // myaction.cpp - A plug-in source file:

    #include "myaction.h"

    // create the plug-ins definition
    DZ_PLUGIN_DEFINITION( "My Plug-in", 0x01000000 );

    // export the new action class from the plug-in
    DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_FACTORY( MyAction, 0x00001000 );

    MyAction::MyAction() : DzAction(
        "My Action",                        // The menu text for the action
        "This performs a new custom action" // The description of the action
        )
    {
        setObjectName( "MyAction" );
    }

    QKeySequence MyAction::getDefaultAccel() const
    {
        // Provide a keyboard shortcut for the action
        return QKeySequence( SHIFT + CTRL + M );
    }

    void MyAction::executeAction()
    {
        // this gets called when the action is activated
        // do something here...
    }

Also see the A First Plug-in Action/Dialog sample sample for a simple example of an action item plug-in.

See also:
DzActionMgr::getAction(), DzActionMgr::findAction()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzAction::DzAction ( const QString &  text = QString::null,
const QString &  desc = QString::null 
) [protected]

Disables/Enables the action in the interface.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the action will be greyed out in menus, and the user will be unable to activate it, if false, the action will be enabled.
See also:
setEnabled()

Enables/Disables the action in the interface.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the action will be displayed normally in menus, and the user will be able to activate it, if false, the action will be disabled.
See also:
setDisabled()

Activates the action programatically.

See also:
toggle()

Toggles the action programatically.

See also:
trigger()

Activates the action in the 'Hover' state programatically.

See also:
trigger()

Sets the action's toggle state.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the action's toggle state is set on, otherwise, its toggle state is set off.
See also:
setOff()

Sets whether the action is visible in the interface.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the action will be displayed in menus and toolbars that it has been added to. If false, the action will not be displayed in any menus or toolbars.

Emitted when an action is enabled or disabled. onOff is true if the action was enabled, false if it was disabled.

Emitted when an action has changed.

Emitted when an action is highlighted by the user; for example, when the user pauses with the cursor over a menu option, toolbar button, or presses an action's shortcut key combination.

Emitted when a toggle action changes state. checked is the new action state, true for on, false for off.

Emitted when an action is activated by the user; for example, when the user clicks a menu option, toolbar button, or presses an action's shortcut key combination, or when trigger() was called. Notably, it is not emitted when setChecked() or toggle() is called. checked is true if the action is checked, or false if the action is unchecked.

Creates a new DzAction.

Parameters:
text The text of the action. This is displayed in menus the action is added to unless a different menu text is specified.
desc The description of the action.

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void DzAction::executeAction (  )  [protected, virtual, slot]

This function is called whenever the action is activated (clicked). Subclasses can reimplement this function to perform their function when activated.

Reimplemented in DzSaveFilterAction, and DzAssetIOFilterAction.

QString DzAction::getActionGroup (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
The group that the action belongs to. This is used for grouping realted actions together when displaying the list of available actions to the user. Subclasses should reimplement this function when appropriate. This function returns "Miscellaneous" by default.

Reimplemented in DzViewToolAction, DzSaveFilterAction, DzAssetIOFilterAction, DzPaneAction, DzCreateItemAction, and DzEditAction.

QKeySequence DzAction::getDefaultAccel (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
The accelerator (keyboard shortcut) for the action if the user has not specified an accelerator. The default is an empty key sequence (no keyboard shortcut). Subclasses should reimplement this if they wish to provide a default accelerator. If the accelerator given is already in use by another action, this action will have no accelerator.
QString DzAction::getDefaultMenuPath (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
The location of the action in the main or pane menus if the user has not specified a location.

DAZ Studio uses this location for the action when it is first added from a plug-in, or when the interface is reset. An empty string (the default) signifies that the action is not added to a menu, unless the user adds it. If a submenu does not exist at the given path, one will be created.

    class MyAction : public DzAction {
    public:
        MyAction();
        virtual QString getDefaultMenuPath() const { return tr( "MyActions" ); }
    };

A string containing a pair of colons "::" signifies that the action is added to a DzPane subclass menu. The name of that subclass must precede the pair. If more than one pair is used, the string is ignored and the action is treated the same fashion as if were an empty string.

    class MyAction : public DzAction {
    public:
        MyAction();
        virtual QString getDefaultMenuPath() const { return "DzHierarchyPane::MyActions"; }
    };

Reimplemented in DzViewToolAction, DzSaveFilterAction, DzAssetIOFilterAction, DzPaneAction, DzCreateItemAction, and DzEditAction.

QString DzAction::getDefaultShortcut (  )  const
Returns:
The accelerator (keyboard shortcut) for the action if the user has not specified an accelerator. The default is an empty key sequence (no keyboard shortcut). Subclasses should reimplement this if they wish to provide a default accelerator. If the accelerator given is already in use by another action, this action will have no accelerator.
QString DzAction::getDefaultToolBar (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
The name of the tool bar that this action is in if the user has not specified a tool bar. DAZ Studio adds the action to the tool bar with this name when the action is first added from a plug-in, or when the interface is reset. An empty string (the default) signifies that the action is not added to a toolbar, unless the user adds it. If a toolbar of the given name does not exist in the interface, one will be created.

Reimplemented in DzViewToolAction.

QString DzAction::getDescription (  )  const
Returns:
The description that is displayed to the user in the list of keyboard shortcuts.
See also:
setDescription()
QString DzAction::getIconFile (  )  const
Returns:
The path of the image file that is currently being used as the icon for this action. The path may be absolute, or relative to the resources directory (see DzApp::getResourcesPath()).
See also:
setIconFile()
bool DzAction::getShowTextWithIcon (  )  const
Returns:
true if this action shows text with its icon
void DzAction::init (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by the framework after it has finished creating the interface. Subclasses can reimplement this function to perform initialization operations that need the interface to be fully created.

Reimplemented in DzPaneAction.

void DzAction::setDescription ( const QString &  description  ) 

Sets the description of the action.

Parameters:
description The description that is displayed to the user in the list of keyboard shortcuts.
See also:
getDescription()
void DzAction::setIcon ( const QString &  path  ) 

Sets the path of the image file that is used as the icon for this action. This is saved out to the Action Manager (*.dsx) file, so calling this function sets the icon for the action persistently between executions of DAZ Studio. The path can be absolute, or relative to the resources directory (see DzApp::getResourcesPath()).

Parameters:
path The file that will be loaded for the action's icon.
See also:
setIconFile()
void DzAction::setIcon ( QStyle::StandardPixmap  pix  ) 

Sets the icon for the action with a statndard pixmap from the current style.

Parameters:
pix The enumerated value for the standard pixmap to use as the action's icon.
void DzAction::setOff ( bool  onOff  )  [slot]

The same as calling setChecked( !onOff ). This method is provided for convenience when connecting this slot to a signal that emits a value that is the inverse of the desired onOff state.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the action's toggle state is set off, otherwise, its toggle state is set on.
See also:
setChecked()
void DzAction::setShowTextWithIcon ( bool  onOff  ) 
Parameters:
onOff set this action to show text with its icon
void DzAction::setToolTipWithAcceleratorText ( QString  tipText  )  [protected]

Sets the tool tip text for the action by appending the result of toolTipAcceleratorText() to the given string.

Parameters:
tipText The new tool tip text for the action - the accelerator text, if any, will be appended to this and set as the new tool tip for the action.
void DzAction::styleChange (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by the framework when the application style changes. The default implementation updates the icon for the action if necessary.

void DzAction::toggleAction ( bool  onOff  )  [protected, virtual, slot]

This function is called whenever the action is toggled. Toggle action subclasses can reimplement this function to perform their function when toggled.

Parameters:
onOff If true, the action is currently toggled on, otherwise, the action is currently off.

Reimplemented in DzViewToolAction, and DzPaneAction.

QString DzAction::toolTipAcceleratorText (  )  const [protected]
Returns:
The user-readable string representing the current keyboard accelerator for the action, or an empty string if no accelerator is assigned.
void DzAction::updateInlineHelp (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by the framework to rebuild the tool tip, and status tip strings when the keyboard shortcut of the action has changed.
